text.__SUMMARY__: Conus episcopatus common name the dignified cone, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 40 mm and 115 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the tropical Indo-West Pacific, off the Mascarenes; off India; off Australia (Queensland).
